snippet: The number of casualties from fighting has fallen in recent months, a senior official said, but killings, abductions and torture are still being reported.
abstract: United Nations estimates at least 9,160 people have died in conflict-related violence in Ukraine since fighting began between government forces and pro-Russian groups in April 2014.
lead_paragraph: The number of casualties from fighting has fallen in recent months, a senior official said, but killings, abductions and torture are still being reported.

headline.main: Death Toll in Ukraine Conflict Hits 9,160, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Ukraine: Conflict’s Toll Put at 9,160
